channel.title: How to copy files from your server to another
channel.description:
this usually comes in handy when you are starting on another server, using two servers with different ips (say like two worlds on runescape), or making something like a pvp server (which is what i am doing).
The difficulty of this should not be hard it is basicly copy and paste... This is for a windows operating system only.
[ul][li] Step one, click start [/li] [li] Now go over to accesories and click system tools [/li] [li] Select Schedual task, from the menu[/li] [li] Now for the code part open up notepad and copy this into it[/ul] [code]@echo off copy "c:\your client folder" "c:\your other client folder"[/code]
[ul][li] Now after that edit the two things that say your client folder with the folder of the documents you want to copy, save it as "copy.bat"[/li] [li]then open up schedualed tasks and click next, then browse for your .bat file and select it, after that choose when to preform the task[/li][/ul]
Thanks for your time, i ran outa room to write but at leaste i got enough space for the tutorial.

item.title: How to copy files from your server to another
item.dc:creator: @Javafire Javafire
item.description:
@Javafire wrote:

this usually comes in handy when you are starting on another server, using two servers with different ips (say like two worlds on runescape), or making something like a pvp server (which is what i am doing).

The difficulty of this should not be hard it is basicly copy and paste…
This is for a windows operating system only.

[ul][li] Step one, click start [/li]
[li] Now go over to accesories and click system tools [/li]
[li] Select Schedual task, from the menu[/li]
[li] Now for the code part open up notepad and copy this into it[/ul]

@echo off copy "c:\your client folder" "c:\your other client folder"

[ul][li] Now after that edit the two things that say your client folder with the folder of the documents you want to copy, save it as “copy.bat”[/li]
[li]then open up schedualed tasks and click next, then browse for your .bat file and select it, after that choose when to preform the task[/li][/ul]

Thanks for your time, i ran outa room to write but at leaste i got enough space for the tutorial.

Read full topic
item.source: How to copy files from your server to another
